definition: Chinese character dictionary (containing entries for single characters, contrasted with a 詞典|词典[ci2 dian3], which has entries for words of one or more characters)/(coll.) dictionary/CL:本[ben3]
letter/symbol/character/word/CL:個|个[ge4]/courtesy or style name traditionally given to males aged 20 in dynastic China
canon/law/standard work of scholarship/literary quotation or allusion/ceremony/to be in charge of/to mortgage or pawn
walking dictionary/well-informed person
the Kangxi Dictionary, named after the Kangxi Emperor, who in 1710 ordered its compilation, containing 47,035 single-character entries
Hanyu Da Zidian, one of the most comprehensive Chinese character dictionaries with 54,678 (and later 60,370) entries, first published between 1986-1990

sentences.english: He bought an English-Chinese dictionary in order to look up the words he doesn't know.
sentences.chinese: 他买了本英汉字典，以便查找他不认识的单词。

sentences.english: Look up the dictionary and explain the meaning of the italicized words.
sentences.chinese: 查字典然后解释斜体词的意思。

sentences.english: He is, as it were , a walking dictionary.
I asked her for the dictionary she borrowed from me, but she just fobbed me off with a stupid excuse.
sentences.chinese: 借我的字典还给我，她却胡乱找个借口把我搪塞过去。

sentences.english: A dictionary is a list of words or expressions defined by the user.
sentences.chinese: 一个字典就是指由用户定义的一组单词或表达式。

sentences.english: The teacher recommended buying an English-Chinese dictionary.
sentences.chinese: 老师建议买一本英汉字典。

sentences.english: I disposed of the dictionaries in convenient and quickly accessible places .
sentences.chinese: 我把字典整齐地放在便于迅速拿到的地方。

sentences.english: This dictionary goes on the top shelf.
We've planning out an English-Chinese dictionary.
sentences.chinese: 我们正在准备编一部英汉字典。

sentences.english: Dictionaries are still good for obscure usages and etymologies.
sentences.chinese: 字典依然擅长于不常用的用法和词源。

sentences.english: Would you give me the diction whose cover is red.
sentences.chinese: 你能把那本字典给我吗？就是那本皮是红的。

sentences.english: Can you recommend me a good English – Chinese dictionary ?
sentences.chinese: 你能推荐一本好的英汉字典给我吗？

sentences.english: Our English teacher suggested our buying a good English Chinese dictionary.
sentences.chinese: 英语老师建议我们买一本好的英汉字典。

sentences.english: Their meaning, that can be looked up in the dictionary, is denotative.
sentences.chinese: 他们的意义是外延的，是可以在字典中查到的。

sentences.english: There's a third way to access a particular dictionary entry.
sentences.chinese: 访问一个特殊的字典条目还有第三个方法。

sentences.english: Mr. Johnson was known as a walking dictionary.
sentences.chinese: 约翰逊先生被称作一本活字典。

definition: dictionary/also written 辭典|辞典[ci2 dian3]/CL:部[bu4],本[ben3]
Cihai, an encyclopedic dictionary first published in 1915, and frequently revised
dictionary/also written 詞典|词典[ci2 dian3]/CL:本[ben3],部[bu4]
phrase (grammar)
reference book (such as dictionary, almanac, gazetteer etc)
word stock/lexicon
word/CL:個|个[ge4]
Hanyu Da Zidian, one of the most comprehensive Chinese character dictionaries with 54,678 (and later 60,370) entries, first published between 1986-1990
(computer) character repertoire/glossary, lexicon
Zihui, Chinese character dictionary with 33,179 entries, released in 17th century
word (general term including monosyllables through to short phrases)/term (e.g. technical term)/expression
vocabulary/list of words (e.g. for language teaching purposes)/word
variant of 詞彙|词汇[ci2 hui4]
sentence
meaning of a word
grammar
new word (in textbook)/word that is unfamiliar or not yet studied/CL:組|组[zu3],個|个[ge4]
vocabulary notebook
